intro: Colea tetragona, commonly known as the four-angled colea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its square stems and small, clustered white flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Colea tetragona is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas.
